result.execSummary:
The defendant Korie J Randall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/30/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/30/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 9 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work crew, child care, medical care.
No drivers license suspension.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Korie J Randall
Current: 2659 N 23rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 06-15-2017)
Prior: 2032 N. 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Korie J Randall in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 9 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work crew, child care, medical care.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/30/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/30/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Korie J Randall in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/30/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Korie J Randall in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Ronald Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Continued Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Warren Spottek-MCSD Detective.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Korie J Randall in court with attorney Daryl Kastenson for Anne A. Devitt.  Ronald Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Rolando Franco-MPD Officer. State is requesting an adjournment for further testimony.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Continued Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescriptions.

Defendant Korie J Randall in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Korie J Randall in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
